page.title: 15HOUSING IN HADFIELD 2
page.content: As you walk through Hadfield you notice that some of the old terraced houses were built of sandstone. You can tell they were old houses because the houses were black and dirty. This was because of the smoke from the mills that used to be there. Some people have had their old houses sandblasted so they look new not old. Before 1845 houses had slabs of stone for the roof but in 1845 people built a railway which came from Manchester to Sheffield to Lincoln so when they had that they could bring slates on the railway for the roofs. The slates came from North Wales.Slate was better than stone as it was much lighter. In the centre of the area is Mersey Bank House a large detached house built of sandstone with a slate roof. It is now an old people's home.
